Class MockSecurityService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ikanow.aleph2.data_model.interfaces.shared_services.MockSecurityService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ISecurityService, IUnderlyingService

    public class MockSecurityService
extends Object
implements ISecurityService
    A useful mock object for unit testing. Allows everything
    Author:
    acp

    • Method Detail

      • getUnderlyingArtefacts

        public Collection<Object> getUnderlyingArtefacts()
        Description copied from interface: IUnderlyingService
        This method needs to be implemented by the underlying management DB and return an object from each dependency (normally just the CRUD service, maybe the search index service also) This enables context libraries to grab the associated JAR files and place them in external processes' classpaths. This method will also return the underlying CRUD service itself, for convenience NOTE: by convention should also return "this"
        Specified by:
        getUnderlyingArtefacts in interface IUnderlyingService
        Returns:

      • getUnderlyingPlatformDriver

        public <T> Optional<T> getUnderlyingPlatformDriver(Class<T> driver_class,
                                                   Optional<String> driver_options)
        Description copied from interface: IUnderlyingService
        USE WITH CARE: this returns the driver to the underlying technology shouldn't be used unless absolutely necessary! One standard use is in analytics, where the driver_class is an instance of IAnalyticsAccessContext and the driver options are "owner_id:bucket_full_name:JSON(input_config)" ... this enables analytics engines to request input drivers from data services without the two really knowing about each other
        Specified by:
        getUnderlyingPlatformDriver in interface IUnderlyingService
        Parameters:
        driver_class - the class of the driver
        Returns:
        a driver to the underlying technology. Will exception if you pick the wrong one!

      • isUserPermitted

        public boolean isUserPermitted(String userID,
                               Object assetOrPermission,
                               Optional<String> oAction)
        Description copied from interface: ISecurityService
        Checks if a user has permission on a specific object,e.g.a DataBucketBEan etc. The service must be logged in as a system user to check the permission. The objectId or fullName will be extracted and the check will be performed.
        Specified by:
        isUserPermitted in interface ISecurityService
        assetOrPermission - the permissible object.
        oAction - - read,write or wildcard action for permission
        Returns:
        true if user has permission, false otherwise

      • getCurrentSubject

        public ISubject getCurrentSubject()
        Description copied from interface: ISecurityService
        This method provides the currently logged in subject (user). This function facilitates a callback access to the current user for further external security checks,e.g by the JVM security manager. The current user can be either a directly logged in user or the system user using runAs() from a is permitted call etc.
        Specified by:
        getCurrentSubject in interface ISecurityService
        Returns:
